results.title: What is a firefighter?
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch, David Ferris and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Trevor Lunn introduces Brion Jones, Station Officer, M.F.B. who outlines the training and different tasks performed by fireman including rescuing people from fires, extinguishing fires, preventing the spread and property damage caused by fires, road rescue, assisting with chemical incidents, gas leaks and unusual rescues from cliffs, trenches and drains.

results.title: What is a curriculum day?
results.creator_credit: TV Ed Productions, Lily Steiner and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: A primary and postprimary teacher and parent/school councillor outline what is involved in a curriculum day. They discuss the benefits for both parents and teachers in evaluating school programs and ideas to facilitate the development of working relationships between both parties.

results.title: What is a computer? (NP)
results.creator_credit: Video Arts, International Computers and Robert Reid
results.brief_description: This film gives an introduction to the computer. Explains the relationship between the central processing unit and the computer’s peripherals - the video console, the printer, the card reader, the magnetic tape unit and the disc unit. Narrated by John Cleese. Also suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: What is a computer?
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films, John Halas and Stanley Hayward
results.brief_description: Uses animation to dispel some of the mysteries about computers, while systematically presenting the basic ideas about computer operations. Explains storage of information, processing of input data, and printing out of responses. Demonstrates use of a flow chart and the diagram logic circuits of the AND, NOT and OR relations. An excellent and interesting explanation for beginners. Writen by Stan Hayward.

results.title: What in the world is water
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, George Pearson and Martin Defallo
results.brief_description: Water is a willing worker; shaping the land, shifting earth or rock, carrying the food by which plants survive and so supporting other forms of life. Water is also beautiful: raindrops pelting the earth, the mighty cataract of Niagara.

results.title: What if your town....?
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Film Corporation and Barry Pierce
results.brief_description: This film shows how to set up a “mutual aid” plan, which is a system of self-help whereby members of an industrial estate can pool their disaster and fire fighting resources for their mutual benefit.

results.title: What I have written [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Beyond Films, Early Works, Peter Sainsbury and John Hughes
results.brief_description: John Scott based the screenplay of this Australian marital drama, which explores notions of identity and fidelity, on his novel of the same name. Sorel and Christopher’s marriage is just recovering from an extended period of alienation, when Christopher, a writer and poet, suffers an apparently fatal stroke. Shortly afterwards Sorel receives a manuscript written by her husband, of which she knows nothing. To her chagrin it reads as a thinly veiled account of their disintegrating marriage and a recent affair of her husband’s conducted whilst they were holidaying in Paris. Sorel reads Christopher’s novella and discovers his secret erotic yearnings for others and disgust for her. But is it true? Sorel can only hopelessly rage at her comatose husband whilst attempting to unravel their past. Assuming a sophisticated style, the film utilises stills, black and white photography, and a shifting voiceover to convey a multi-layered narrative. But despite its stylish aesthetic, an over reliance on such devices, which attempts to instil the mise-en-scene with a sense of mystery and eroticism, stagnates the narrative and exacerbates the film’s contrived posturing.

results.title: What have you done with my country (A)
results.creator_credit: Cinetel Film Production Services, Douglass Baglin and Frank Heimans
results.brief_description: Shows what has happened to the land of the first Australians after the Europeans found it and settled it less than 200 years ago. It deliberates on the present state of the Aborigines who have no rights to land and whose culture is overshadowed by the white man’s. Includes readings from Kath Walker’s “We are going”, archival drawings of early European settlement, historical newsreel footage (Vietnam moratorium marches, mining and minerals boom, technological and industrial development etc.) Also emphasises the devastation to the animal world through man’s continual development of the natural environment for commercial gain. Photography by Douglass Baglin, narrated by Tim Elliott.

results.title: What have I done to deserve this? = Que he hecho yo para merecer esto?
results.creator_credit: Tesauro S A, Kaktus S A, Tadeo Villabla and Pedro Almodovar
results.brief_description: Gloria is a housewife with attitude. She has to be: one son is a drug dealer, her youngest son is having an affair with the family dentist, her husband can’t excite her anymore, and her mother-in-law is determined to drive her crazy. To survive in the concrete jungle of Madrid, Gloria snorts cleaning powders and searches for sex with masculine strangers. This wickedly funny movie is an early feature by Almodovar and it revels in inverting and satirising the conventions of television soap opera and of the Hollywood “women’s film”. Absurd, fast-paced and stylistically innovative, “What Have I Done to Deserve This?” stars the fabulous Carmen Maura.
